org.drooms.impl.logic

Class DecisionMaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drooms.impl.logic.DecisionMaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.drools.runtime.Channel

    public class DecisionMaker
extends Object
implements org.drools.runtime.Channel
    Represents a Player's Strategy in action. This class holds and maintains Drools engine's state for each particular player.

    When asked (see decideNextMove()), the strategy should make a decision on the next move, based on the current state of the working memory. This decision should be sent over the provided 'decision' channel. If not sent, it will default to STAY. See Move for the various types of decisions.

    This class enforces the following requirements on the strategies:

    • 'gameEvents' entry point must be declared, where the events not directly related to player actions will be sent. These events are CollectibleAdditionEvent and CollectibleRemovalEvent.
    • 'playerEvents' entry point must be declared, where the player-caused events will be sent. These events are PlayerMoveEvent and PlayerDeathEvent.
    • 'rewardEvents' entry point must be declared, where the reward events will be sent. These events are CollectibleRewardEvent and SurvivalRewardEvent.

    This class provides the following Drools globals, if declared in the strategy:

    • 'logger' implementation of the Logger interface, to use for logging from within the rules.
    • 'tracker' instance of the PathTracker, to facilitate path-finding in the rules.

    Your strategies can be validated for all these - just make your tests extend DroomsTestHelper.

    The working memory will contain instances of the various helper fact types:

    • GameProperty, many. Will never change or be removed.
    • CurrentPlayer, once. Will never change or be removed.
    • CurrentTurn, once. Will change with every turn.
    • Wall, many. Will remain constant over the whole game.
    • Worm, many. Will be added and removed as the worms will move, but never modified.

      • decideNextMove

        public Move decideNextMove()
        Call on the Drools engine to make the decision on worm's next move, according to the Player's Strategy.
        Returns:
        The move. STAY will be chosen when the strategy doesn't respond.

      • halt

        public void halt()
        Stop the decision-making process, no matter where it currently is.

        public boolean isTerminated()
        Whether or not this object can still be used for decision making.
        Returns:
        False when it can be used.

      • terminate

        public boolean terminate()
        Clean up after this Drools instance. Will terminate the session and leave all the objects up for garbage collection. Only call once and then don't use this object anymore.
        Returns:
        False if already terminated.
